column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I'm currently 42 years old.  I took Entex LA in my mid-20's for about 2-3 years to help me with my asthma which I developed at 21 from sharing an office with chain smokers. I was prescribed to take 1 pill every 12 hours.  If I missed one doze I would get sore throat, if I missed more than one doze I would get a cold which I couldnt get rid of for weeks.  Other than that, it kept me breathing freely but did NOT reduce my asthmatic attacks so I stopped taking it.  Since smoking was banned in public places my asthma started getting better and I have not had an attack in about 4 years.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
TrishS, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Basically this med works to break up the mucous so I can get rid of it and breath better.  Don't you just hate it when you can't breath through your nose?  Or can breath only through one nostril?  What a bummer!  Well, Entex helps to reduce those symptoms and others as well!
